## Discussion

Call this method to restart multipeer syncing with connected peers after calling [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/MultipeerConnectivityService/stopSync()]. You don’t need to call this method to begin syncing. RealityKit calls this method automatically when you assign a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/MultipeerConnectivityService] to a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/Scene].

# startSync()

**Instance Method**

Begins multipeer synchronization.

## Declaration

```swift
func startSync()
```

## Discussion

Call this method to restart multipeer syncing with connected peers after calling [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/MultipeerConnectivityService/stopSync()]. You don’t need to call this method to begin syncing. RealityKit calls this method automatically when you assign a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/MultipeerConnectivityService] to a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/Scene].

## Pausing and resuming

- **stopSync()**: Stops multipeer synchronization.
title: startSync()
